p.span: Letter to Parents and Students concerning 3rd and 4th quarter grades: Please see the letter by clicking on the link

div.p: March 30, 2020: Update: School Closure Date:Governor Doug Ducey announced today that all public and charter schools in the state will be closed for the rest of the school year. Further information may be found at the website of the Arizona Department of Education, click here.

p.font: Bus Drop: Every Monday, our bus will drop off homework packets and meals at the following places at the following times:

div.p: 10:15a: McNeal Gas Station
1030: Double Adobe Store
11:10: Mustang Mall
11:30: Ash Creek School
11:50: Giant QuikMart
12:15p: Richland Store
12:30: Kansas Settlement at Birch Rd

p.span: March 23, 2020: An Open Letter from Governor Doug Ducey.

a.span: Open Letter from the Office of the Governor, March 20, 2020.

p.span: Today, Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman announced that Arizona schools would be closed through April 10. Students will begin coursework through a combination of online learning and packets of homework (delivered by bus drivers). Those details may be found below under "Teacher Directions" post. For communication purposes, we ask each student to make email contact with their teachers if they are able to do so.

strong.span: <---- See Food Service Bulletin under "Public Health Notices" tab at left.

p.span: March 18, 2020: Update: Teacher Directions for Continuing School:
Good morning. We hope you are all safe and sound.

div.p: As you know, public school gatherings have been closed through March 27, and none of us are sure whether or not there will be an extension to that closure. It is incumbent on us, however, to continue offering learning opportunities and instruction to our students.

Among the options available to us are online learning (Odysseyware, Business classes, and some others) and an independent study, wherein teachers send work home in packets to students (to be delivered by bus drivers), and then have those packets returned for grading (also delivered by bus drivers).
As a school, we will also arrange food service to our families.
We will continue to offer education and food service through the end of the year, whether in re-opened schools or through other means.
Heres what that looks like:
Today, Wednesday, March 18, 2020:

ul.li: School administration will contact students and families through our all call Blackboard system, having each student make email contact with each of their teachers. Wed like this for a baseline of communication. Teacher and staff email addresses are available at our website at www.vuhs.net.

Further, all currently enrolled Odysseyware students are expected to resume their assigned coursework. Mrs. Hamberger will monitor progress for those students, as well as offer direct support. For any Odysseyware questions, please contact Mrs. Alisha Hamberger at alisha.hamberger@vuhs.net.

div.p: Monday, March 23 Thursday, March 27:

ul.li: All teachers at Valley Union are to make email contact with their students.

Each teacher is to have ready coursework for the following week (worksheet handouts, from textbooks, or digital learning) that can be delivered to each of their students. Please have that work ready by Thursday morning. Either deliver it to the office, make it available to us to pick up from your classroom, or advise school administration that you will deliver it directly to your students through the Internet.

div.p: Monday, March 30 and beyond:

ul.li: If school is not again in open session the following Monday, March 30, bus drivers will deliver to select bus stops packets of coursework and meals to our students. The following week, students will either bring that work to school with them (if school is in open session), or bus drivers will pick it up and return it to school for the teachers to grade.

We will continue in this fashion until further information dictates a change in operation. Please have coursework ready and available to our office staff by Thursday morning; bus drivers will deliver completed work by the following Monday afternoon.

p.span: As you all probably know, on Sunday, March 15, Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman ordered closed all public and charter schools in the state of Arizona. That given, school and all school activities have been cancelled through March 27, 2020. We will continue to update this site as we learn information and as decisions are made. For any families in our area that rely on school breakfast / lunch programs, please contact Mr. Hart, our superintendent, for information. He may be reached by email at khart@pearceschool.org.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: After careful thought, I have decided to cancel school and all related school activities for the week of March 16-20, 2020. There is so much unknown about this current virus, COVID19, that it is hard to predict with certainty what the correct actions are to take. However, taking any risk with our student population is unwarranted. We have students, staff, parents, and community members with pre-existing medical conditions that puts them in the high risk category for this virus. Hopefully, as more information is made available, we will learn that we are not in a high risk area....but until more information is learned about this virus, I'm not willing to take any risk with our students and our families.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.span: For those families that count on school breakfast/lunch, please contact me, and I will make arrangements to get this out to you.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.span: We will update plans going forward by Saturday, March 21st.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.span: "Three Time Winner of Best Schools in America Medal"

Welcome to the Valley Union High School District #22 website. We are located in the community of Elfrida, AZ in Southeastern Arizona approximately 25 miles north of Douglas, AZ. Valley Union High School serves students fromfive elementaryschool districts; Ash Creek Elementary, Double Adobe Elementary, Elfrida Elementary, McNeal Elementary, and Pearce Elementary as well as students from many communities in Southeastern Cochise County.

Valley Union High School prides itself on its academic and co-curricular offerings and success. The school is rated a "A" school by the Arizona Department of Education and offers dual-credit/reverse credit opportunities with Cochise College.The school provides students with academic programssuch as band, choir, agriculture, business/computers, culinary arts, drawing/painting, pottery, and drama. Our current student to teacher ratio is 11:1. Students at Valley Union High School participate in co-extracurricular activities such as 8-man Football, Volleyball, Basketball, Baseball, Softball, Track, Tennis, FFA, FCCLA, and Knowledge Bowl.

font.span: Inspire all students to be life-long learners.

div.p: Valley Union High School's mission is to provide a well-rounded education to all students by cultivating a genuine desire for learning, service, and achievement.

Parents & Students: If you have any fines, fees, school athletic equipment, library materials, or other school materials that are due or out you will not receive your report cards or diplomas until the fines/fees are paid & all materials are returned.

NOTICE: From this point forward all VALLEY UNION HIGH SCHOOL surplus materials will be listed on www.publicsurplus.com. Please visit this site to see the different items that are available for auction.

p.strong: Check out the link to Rokkitwear for Valley Union High School Apparel. Rokkitwear is an AIA approved vendor and shares its profits with VUHS.
